# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

This is a personal portfolio website built with Next.js 15, React 19, and TypeScript. It showcases projects, blog posts, and professional services.

## Essential Commands

```bash
npm run dev      # Start development server (port 3000)
npm run build    # Production build
npm run lint     # ESLint check
npm run format   # Prettier formatting
npm test         # Run Vitest tests
```

## Architecture

### Content System
- **MDX Blog Posts**: `/content/posts/*.mdx` - Frontmatter with title, excerpt, date, coverImage, tags
- **Projects**: `/content/projects.ts` - TypeScript array with slug, title, description, tags, image, featured flag
- **Services**: `/content/services.ts` - Service offerings data
- **Clients**: `/content/clients.ts` - Client logos and info

### Key Patterns
- **App Router**: All pages in `/app` directory using Next.js 15 conventions
- **Dynamic Routes**: `/app/blog/[slug]` and `/app/projects/[slug]` for detail pages
- **Data Fetching**: `/lib/*.ts` modules export functions for content retrieval
- **Components**: Shared UI in `/components`, shadcn/ui primitives in `/components/ui`
- **Types**: Centralized in `/types/*.ts`

### Styling
- Tailwind CSS with custom theme in `tailwind.config.ts`
- CSS variables for theming in `globals.css`
- Inter font via next/font

### Testing
- Vitest for unit tests
- Jest for integration tests (parallel config)

## Code Quality Rules

1. **TypeScript**: Strict mode, explicit types for exports
2. **Components**: Functional with proper prop interfaces
3. **Imports**: Prefer `@/` alias for absolute imports
4. **Naming**: PascalCase components, camelCase functions, UPPER_SNAKE constants

## Documentation Requirements

All code changes should be documented in:
- `/docs/CHANGELOG.md` for version history
- `/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md` for structural changes
- Inline JSDoc for complex functions

Tool Used: Read
{"file_path": "/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md"}

Tool Result:
# Architecture Documentation

## Overview

This is a Next.js 15 portfolio website using the App Router, React 19, and TypeScript. The architecture follows a content-driven design with static generation for optimal performance.

## Technology Stack

### Core
- **Next.js 15**: App Router, Server Components, Static Generation
- **React 19**: Latest features including use() hook
- **TypeScript**: Strict mode for type safety

### Styling
- **Tailwind CSS**: Utility-first styling
- **CSS Variables**: Theme customization in globals.css
- **shadcn/ui**: Accessible UI primitives

### Content
- **MDX**: Blog posts with React components
- **TypeScript Data Files**: Projects, services, clients

## Directory Structure

```
├── app/                    # Next.js App Router pages
│   ├── blog/              # Blog section
│   │   ├── [slug]/        # Dynamic blog post pages
│   │   └── page.tsx       # Blog listing
│   ├── projects/          # Projects section
│   │   ├── [slug]/        # Dynamic project pages
│   │   └── page.tsx       # Projects listing
│   ├── clients/           # Clients showcase
│   ├── contact/           # Contact page
│   ├── layout.tsx         # Root layout
│   └── page.tsx           # Homepage
├── components/            # React components
│   ├── ui/               # shadcn/ui primitives
│   └── *.tsx             # Feature components
├── content/              # Content data
│   ├── posts/            # MDX blog posts
│   ├── projects.ts       # Projects data
│   ├── services.ts       # Services data
│   └── clients.ts        # Clients data
├── lib/                  # Utility functions
│   ├── mdx.ts           # MDX processing
│   ├── posts.ts         # Blog post utilities
│   ├── projects.ts      # Project utilities
│   └── utils.ts         # General utilities
├── types/               # TypeScript types
│   ├── blog.ts          # Blog-related types
│   └── projects.ts      # Project-related types
├── public/              # Static assets
│   ├── clients/         # Client logos
│   ├── projects/        # Project images
│   └── technologies/    # Tech stack icons
└── docs/                # Documentation
```

## Data Flow

### Blog Posts
1. MDX files in `/content/posts/`
2. Processed by `/lib/mdx.ts` using next-mdx-remote
3. Metadata extracted via gray-matter
4. Rendered in `/app/blog/[slug]/page.tsx`

### Projects
1. Data defined in `/content/projects.ts`
2. Fetched via `/lib/projects.ts`
3. Displayed in `/app/projects/page.tsx` and detail pages

## Component Architecture

### Layout Components
- `Header`: Navigation, theme toggle
- `Footer`: Links, social, copyright
- `Navigation`: Main nav with mobile support

### Feature Components
- `Hero`: Homepage hero section
- `ProjectCard`: Project preview cards
- `BlogCard`: Blog post preview cards
- `ServiceCard`: Service offering cards
- `ContactForm`: Contact form with validation

### UI Components (shadcn/ui)
- `Button`: Various button styles
- `Dialog`: Modal dialogs
- `Input`: Form inputs
- `Sheet`: Mobile navigation drawer

## Styling Architecture

### Tailwind Configuration
Custom theme extending default Tailwind with:
- Custom colors for brand consistency
- Extended spacing and typography
- Animation utilities

### CSS Variables
Theme-aware variables in `globals.css`:
- `--background`, `--foreground`
- `--primary`, `--secondary`
- `--muted`, `--accent`

## Performance Optimizations

1. **Static Generation**: All pages pre-rendered at build time
2. **Image Optimization**: Next.js Image component
3. **Font Optimization**: next/font for Inter
4. **Code Splitting**: Automatic with App Router

## SEO Implementation

- Dynamic metadata generation per page
- OpenGraph and Twitter cards
- Sitemap generation (`/app/sitemap.ts`)
- Robots.txt (`/app/robots.ts`)

## Testing Strategy

- **Unit Tests**: Vitest for component logic
- **Integration Tests**: Jest for page rendering
- **Type Checking**: TypeScript strict mode

export default function RootLayout({
  children,
}: {
  children: React.ReactNode;
}) {
  return (
    <html lang="en" suppressHydrationWarning>
      <head>
        <Script
          defer
          data-domain="diegofotesco.com"
          src="https://plausible.io/js/script.js"
        />
      </head>
      <body
        className={cn(
          'min-h-screen font-sans antialiased bg-white dark:bg-black text-gray-900 dark:text-white',
          fontSans.variable
        )}
      >
        <ThemeProvider
          attribute="class"
          defaultTheme="dark"
          enableSystem={false}
          disableTransitionOnChange
        >
          <Header />
          <main className="flex flex-col min-h-screen">{children}</main>
          <Footer />
        </ThemeProvider>
      </body>
    </html>
  );
}

I've completed an initial exploration of the codebase. Here's a summary of what I found:

## Codebase Overview

This is a **personal portfolio website** for Diego Fotesco, built with modern web technologies.

### Technology Stack
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router
- **UI Library**: React 19
- **Language**: TypeScript (strict mode)
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS with shadcn/ui components
- **Content**: MDX for blog posts, TypeScript files for structured data
- **Testing**: Vitest (unit) + Jest (integration)

### Project Structure
- `/app` - Next.js App Router pages (blog, projects, clients, contact)
- `/components` - React components including shadcn/ui primitives
- `/content` - MDX blog posts and TypeScript data files (projects, services, clients)
- `/lib` - Utility functions for content fetching and processing
- `/types` - Centralized TypeScript type definitions
- `/public` - Static assets (logos, images, icons)
- `/docs` - Documentation (architecture, changelog, testing, etc.)

### Key Patterns
1. **Content-driven architecture** with static generation
2. **Dynamic routes** for blog posts (`/blog/[slug]`) and projects (`/projects/[slug]`)
3. **MDX processing** via next-mdx-remote with rehype plugins
4. **Theme support** via next-themes with dark mode default
5. **SEO optimized** with dynamic metadata, sitemap, and robots.txt

### Essential Commands
- `npm run dev` - Development server with Turbopack
- `npm run build` - Production build
- `npm run lint` - ESLint check
- `npm test` - Run Vitest tests

### Critical Files for Implementation
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/app/layout.tsx` - Root layout with theme provider and metadata
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/CLAUDE.md` - AI assistant guidance for the project
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md` - Full architecture documentation
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/lib/mdx.ts` - MDX processing logic
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/content/projects.ts` - Projects data structure
